dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winter in San Francisco cold, foggy.  Cop cars everywhere The lights play through the thick fog.  Two Homicide dete get out of the car, walk into the house. NICK CURRAN is 42.  Trim, good-looking, a nice suit; a fa urban, edged, shadowed.  GUS MORAN is 64.  Crew-cut, silv beard, a suit rumpled and shiny, a hat out of the 50'sa f worn and ruined the face of a backwoods philosopher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's money here -- deco, clean, hip -- That looks like Picasso on the wall.  They check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was this fuckin' guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rock and roll, Gus.  Johnny Boz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never heard of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) Before your time, pop. (a beat) Mid-sixties.  Five or six hits. He's got a club down in the Fillmore  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now he don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Past the uniformed guys... nods... waves... past the fore men... past the coroner's investigators... they get to th bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk in, stare -- it's messy. It's like a convention in here.  LT. PHIL WALKER, in his silver-haired, the Homicide guys; JIM HARRIGAN, late 40's puffy, affable;  SAM ANDREWS, 30's, black.  A CORONER'S M working the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nick and Gus) You guys know Captain Talcott?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the Chief's office doin'  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Observing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Coroner's  Guy) What do you think, Doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skin blanches when I press it -- this kind of color is about right  for six or eight hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody say anything.  The maid  came in an hour ago and found him. She's not a live-in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the maid did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's 54 years old and weighs 240  pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan) There are no bruises on his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) It ain't the maid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He left the club with his girlfriend  about midnight.  That's the last  time anybody saw him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at body) What was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice pick.  Left on the coffee table  in the living room.  Thin steel  handle.  Forensics took it downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's come all over the sheets -- he got off before he got offed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan) That rules the maid out for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is sensitive.  Mr. Boz was a  major contributor to the mayor's  campaign.  He was Chairman of the  Board of the Palace of Fine Arts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nick) I thought you said he was a rock  and roll star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a retired rock and roll  star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A civic-minded, very respectable  rock and roll star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the white powder laid out in lines on the small mi on the side table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan) It looks like some civic-minded,  very respectable cocaine to me,  Gus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (evenly, to Nick) Listen to me, Curran.  I'm going  to get a lot of heat on this.  I  don't want any... mistakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Talcott look at each other a beat, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Walker looks at the notepad in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine Tramell, 162 Divisadero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick writes it down.  He and Gus turn, leave.  Captain Ta watches them.  He looks disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they head out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talcott doesn't usually show up at  the office 'till after his 18 holes.   What are they nervous about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're executives.  They're nervous  about everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, turns, sees Walker behind them.  Walker comes u them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nick) Keep your three o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to work the case,  Phil, or do you want me to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said keep it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is more a mansion than a house.  They ring the bell. Hispanic MAID answers.  They flash their badges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Detective Curran, this is  Detective Moran.  We're with the  San Francisco Police Department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd like to speak to Ms. Catherine Tramell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat, an  accent) Just moment.  Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads them into a lavish, beautifully done living roo that offers a sweeping view of the Bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit, please.  Just moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look around, impressed.  There is a Picasso on the w here, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't that cute?  They got his and  her Pig-assos, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I didn't know you knew who Picasso  was, Gus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) I'm a smart sonofabitch.  I just  hide it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick smiles -- and at that moment a beautiful BLONDE walk into the room.  She looks like she has been asleep.  She her early 20's.  She wears a very sheer robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're sorry to disturb you, we'd  like to ask you some --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you vice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Homicide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was the last time you saw  John Boz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Why do you think he's dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't be here otherwise,  would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you with him last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're looking for Catherine, not  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Roxy. (a beat) I'm her -- friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at them a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's out at the beach house at  Stinson.  Seadrift.  1402.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start to head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wasting your time. Catherine  didn't kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, they look at her, and go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foggy.  Cold.  It is an expensive spit of land on the oce Multi-million dollar "beach houses" with gardens and swim pools.  There are two Ferraris in the driveway -- one bla one white. They get out of the car in front of the house.  They see woman in back of the house, sitting on a deck chair, star at the sea, a blanket around her.  As they get to her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Tramell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a long look a Nick, then looks away. CATHERINE TRAMELL is 30 years old.  She has long blonde h and a refined, classically beautiful face.  She is not kn gorgeous like Roxy; there is a smoky kind of sensuousness her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm De...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (evenly) I know who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't look at them.  She looks at the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did he die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.  Maybe that's why you're  from Homicide.  How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick glances at Gus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With an ice pick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes her eyes a beat and then, still staring out, w a thin smile.  They see it, too, and glance at each other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long were you dating him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't dating him.  I was fucking  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They glance at each other again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you -- a pro?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine looks at him -- that thin smile again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'm an amateur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long were you having sex with  him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About a year and a half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you with him last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you leave the club with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you go home with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  We had a drink at the club. We left together.  I came here.   He went home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there anyone with you last  night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at Nick) No.  I wasn't in the mood to have  sex with anyone last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at her a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me ask you something, Ms. Tramell?  Are you sorry he's dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I liked fucking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at her.  She looks out at the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really feel like talking  anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, lady, we can do this  downtown if you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read me my rights and arrest me  and I'll go downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't even look at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Otherwise, get the fuck out of  here.  Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat as they look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door says Dr. Elizabeth Gardner, Counseling.  Nick op the door, peeks in.  The receptionist is not there.  A cl says 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks in -- sees the inner door open, walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Beth.  I -- I got hung  up in Stinson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. ELIZABETH GARDNER, the police psychologist, is a very looking, dark-haired woman.  She is 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) How are you, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.  Come on, Beth!  You  know I'm fine!  How the hell long  do I have to keep doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as Internal Affairs wants  you to, I suppose.  Sit down, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bullshit.  You know it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I know it is -- but sit down anyway  so we can get it over with, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So -- how are things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Things are fine.  I told you. They're fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches him closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) How is your -- personal life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sex life is fine. (a beat) My sex life is pretty shitty  actually since I stopped seeing  you -- maybe I should think about  my Electrolux again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That embarrassed her; she looks away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shrugs.  A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about the booze?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been three months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a long beat) How about the coke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hard) No!  I'm working my tail off.  I'm  off the sauce, I'm not even smoking  anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's not smoking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fucked -- now will you please  tell I.A. that I'm just you average  healthy totally fucked-up cop and  let me get out of here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat; smiles) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he starts heading out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (behind him) I still miss you, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't even turn, pretends he didn't hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks in.  Gus Moran gets up from his desk as soon as sees him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talcott's in there.  They're  waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start heading for Lt. Walker's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She misses me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) Hallelujah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Gus sit there with Lt. Walker, Harrigan, Andrews a Captain Talcott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixteen stab wounds to the chest  and neck.  No usable prints, no  forcible entry, nothing missing. No prints on the ice pick, either -- it's available at any Safeway. The scarf is Hermes, expensive -- they sell about 20,000 a year  worldwide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The powder was cocaine, high- quality, high-content.  He inhaled  it; there were minute quantities  on his lips and penis.  Mr. Boz  leaves five million dollars, no  insurance, no direct survivors.   He liked his coke, he liked his  girls, and he liked rock and roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He liked the mayor, too, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talcott gives him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about his girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she relevant here?  I didn't  know she was a suspect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a suspect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On what basis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks a notes) Catherine Tramell.  Age 30.  No  priors, no convictions.  Double  major, magnum cum laude, Berkeley,  1980.  Literature and Psychology. Daughter, sole survivor -- Marvin  and Elaine Tramell, killed in a  boating accident, 1978, Catherine  Tramell sole heir.  Estimated assets  $110 million.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hangs there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continues) Formerly engaged to Roberto Vasquez,  deceased --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby Vasquez?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby Vasquez, former middleweight  contender, killed in the ring  Atlantic City, 1984.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I love it.  She's got a hundred  million bucks.  She fucks fighters  and rock and roll stars.  And she's  got a degree in screwing with  peoples' heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgot her degree in literature.   She's a writer.  She published a  novel last year under a pen name.   Do you want to know what it's about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about a retired rock and roll  star who is murdered by his  girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hangs there a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His apartment is very bare -- very few things -- with wid open spaces.  There is a lot of chrome. He sits on the couch, reading a book.  It is a paperback. We see the title -- Love Hurts, by Catherine Adams.  He p the book down a beat, then picks the phone up, dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 67, pop.  Do you know how she  does the boyfriend?  With an  icepick, in bed, his hands tied  with a white silk scarf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, Gus, Lt. Walker, Harrigan, Andrews, Captain Talcott and Beth Gardner.  With them is an older, white-haired ma DR. ANDREW LAMOTT.  There are copies of "Love Hurts" arou the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Gardner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've asked Dr. Lamott to consult  with us.  This isn't really my  turf.  Dr. Lamott teaches the psycho- pathology of psychopathic behavior  at Stanford and is also a member  of the Justice Department's  Psychological Profile team.  Dr.   Lamott?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are two possibilities.  One.   The person who wrote this book is  your murderer and acted out the  killing described in ritualistic,  literal detail.  Two.  Someone who  wants to do the person who wrote  this book harm read the book and  enacted the killing described to  incriminate the writer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a long beat) What if the writer did it?  What  are we dealing with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dealing with a devious,  diabolical mind.  This book must  have been written at least six  months, maybe years before it was  published.  That means the writer  planned the crime, at least in the  subconscious, back then.  The fact  that the writer carried it out  indicates psychopathic obsessive  behavior in terms not only of the  killing itself but in terms of  applied advance defense mechanism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most times I can't tell shit from  shinola, Doc.  What was all that  you just said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some grins, titters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She anticipates the book to be her  best alibi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's going to say Do you think  I'd be dumb enough to kill anyone  in the exact way I've described in  my book?  I wouldn't do that because  I'd know I'd be a suspect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat -- as they think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it's not the writer?  What  if it's someone who read the book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dealing then with someone  so obsessed that he or she is  willing to kill an irrelevant and  innocent victim to place the blame  on the person who wrote this book.   We are talking about deep-seated,  obsessional hatred; an utter lack  of sense of proportion or  perspective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a top-of-the-line, once- in-a-lifetime loony-tune either  way you cut it -- that's what you're  saying, right, Doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dealing with someone very  dangerous and very ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROSECUTOR JOHN CORRIGAN, a big man in his 50's, with Cap Talcott, Lt. Walker, Nick, and Gus. Corrigan is reading a file.  He gets up, yawns, goes to h window, looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you know there's no case  here.  There's no physical evidence --  okay, she doesn't have an alibi  but there's no motive.  Her defense  would just beat us to death with  the copycat thing.  Anybody who  read the book could have done it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat; no one says anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we do -- nothing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) We bring her in for questioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got enough money to burn  this whole department down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was the last person seen with  the guy -- I'll take the  responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't do any good.  She'll come  in with Lee Bailey and Mel Belli  trailing behind her on a solid  gold chain from Tiffanys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes she will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) No she won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I don't think she's going to hide  behind anybody.  I don't think  she's going to hide at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) I think you're as crazy as she  probably is, Curran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicks says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what they say: It takes  one to know one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks a Gus, grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk from the car to the door of the big beach house They ring the bell.  They hear typing inside.  The typing She comes to the door in jeans and a tight-fitting sweats

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Tramell, we'd like you to come  downtown and answer some questions  for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you arresting me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's the way you want to play  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Can I change into something more  appropriate?  It'll just take a  minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is beautifully done in a Santa Fe motif.  She goes to bedroom of the living room. Nick sits down on a couch facing the bedroom she's walked Gus sits across from him, his back to the bedroom. There is a coffee table between them.  She leaves the bed door halfway open. An old newspaper is on the coffee table.  Nick reaches fo The headline says VICE COP CLEARED IN TOURIST SHOOTINGS. headline underneath says GRAND JURY SAYS SHOOTINGS ACCIDE There is a photograph of Nick. He stares at the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long will this take?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick puts the paper down on the coffee table.  He is lost his thoughts.  Gus picks the paper up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks up) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, facing the half open bedroom door, sees a mirror ne the wall of the bedroom.  The mirror reflects her in the corner of the bedroom.  She is taking her clothes off.  H stares.  She strips down.  He sees her back. She has a be body.  Naked, she puts a dress on.  She doesn't put any  underwear on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you always keep old newspapers  around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only when they make interesting  reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she is suddenly out of the bedroom.  She stands there smiles.  They look at each other a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get up, head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the right to an attorney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I need an attorney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit in the front; she is in the back.  The car goes the winding, two-lane Mt. Tamalpais road. The fog is heavy.  It's starting to rain.  We see the bea far below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles, looks at him.  A beat, and he turns away.  An beat, and she lights a cigarette up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were out of  cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found some in my purse; would  you like one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you -- I quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, as she looks at him, and then he turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You workin' on another book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must really be somehtin' --makin'  stuff up all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches her in the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It teaches you to lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make it up, but it has to be  believable.  They call it suspension  of disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like that.  "Suspension of  Disbelief."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles at her in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your new book about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A detective.  He falls for the  wrong woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks right into his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kills him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, as they look at each other, and then he turns awa from her.  Gus watcher her in the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is large, fluorescent-lighted, antiseptic. She walks in with Nick and Gus.  In the room are prosecut John Corrigan, Lt. Walker, Captain Talcott, Harrigan, and Andrews.  There is a police stenographer a plain young wo in her 20's. As soon as she comes in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm John Corrigan.  I'm an assistant  district attorney, Ms.  Tramell.   Can we get you anything?  Would  you like some coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are your attorneys --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hiding a smile) Ms. Tramell waived her right to an  attorney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corrigan and Talcott glance at Nick.  She sees the look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Did I miss something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told them you wouldn't want an  attorney present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why have you waived your right to  an attorney, Ms. Tramell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nick) Why did you think I wouldn't want  one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told them you wouldn't want to  hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have nothing to hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two of them keep their eyes on each other. She sits down.  They sit around her.  Nick sits directly from her.  She lights up a cigarette.  They watch her.   She is poised, cool, in complete command of herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no smoking in this  building, Ms. Tramell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?  Charge  me with smoking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever so casually, she blows her smoke across at Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you tell us the nature of  your relationship with Mr. Boz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had sex with him for about a  year and a half.  I liked having  sex with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has control of the room; she looks from one man to th other as she speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't afraid of experimenting.   I like men like that.  I like men  who give me pleasure.  He gave me  a lot of pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, as they watch her.  She is so matter-of-fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever engage in sado- masochistic activity with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Exactly what do you have in mind,  Mr. Corrigan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat, little  flustered) Did you ever tie him up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never tied him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Johnny liked to use his hands  too much.  I like hands and fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You describe a white silk scarf in  your book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always had a fondness for  white silk scarves. (she smiles) I have a very vivid imagination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you said you liked men to use  their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I said I liked Johnny to use  his hands. (she smiles) I don't give any rules, Nick.  I  go with the flow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have their eyes on each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you kill Mr. Boz, Ms. Tramell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd have to be pretty stupid to  write a book about a killing and  then kill him the way I described  in my book. I'd be announcing myself  as the killer.  I'm not stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know you're not stupid, Ms. Tramell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe that's what you're counting  on to get you off the hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Writing a book about it gives you  an alibi for not killing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it does, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds his eyes a second, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The answer is no.  I didn't kill  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you use drugs, Ms. Tramell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever do drugs with Mr.  Boz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of drugs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks directly at Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever fucked on cocaine? (she smiles) It's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like playing games, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I've got a degree in psych.  It  goes with the turf.  Games are  fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are holding each other's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about boxing?  That's a game. Was that fun for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't take their eyes off each other for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's irrelevant to this  inquiry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nick) Yes it was.  Bobby died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you feel when he died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loved him.  I hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes are still on each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you feel when I told you  Johnny Boz had died -- that day at  the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt somebody had read my book  and was playing a game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you didn't hurt --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you didn't love him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes are digging into each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even though you were fucking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) You still get the pleasure.  Didn't  you ever fuck anybody else while  you were married, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat; he stares at her, expressionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know he was married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching Nick) Maybe I was guessing.  What  difference does it make?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lights a cigarette.  He stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a cigarette, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just stares at her, expressionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you two know each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you meet Mr. Boz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to write a book about the  murder of a retired rock star.  I  went down to his club and picked  him up.  Then I had sex with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't feel anything for him. You just had sex with him for your  book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the beginning.  Then I got to  like what he did for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's pretty cold, ain't it, lady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a writer,  I use people for  what I write.  You write what you  know.  Let the world beware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She and Nick have their eyes on each other, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Corrigan, smiles) Would you like me to take a lie  detector test?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see her in a glass-enclosed cubicle with a polygraph  EXAMINER.  Nick stands outside watching her with Gus and Walker.  Her back is to them.  The Examiner shuts the mac down, gathers rolls of papers, and comes out of the cubic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No blips, no blood pressure  variations, no pulse variance.   Either she's telling the truth or  I've never met anyone like her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat, Nick watches her as she sits inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does somebody beat this machine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ninety-nine point nine percent of  the cases, they don't.  You'd have  to be able to mask the truth from  your own central nervous system,  your circulatory system, your  adrenal glands.  In my opinion,  this woman is telling the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Examiner walks away.  They stand there. Catherine sta at the door of the cubicle behind them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I go now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Yes.  Thanks for coming in, Ms. Tramell.  I'm sorry to inconvenience  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says nothing, has a thin smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask one of you for a ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at her a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he and Catherine walk away.  Gus and Walker watch the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is an old, mint-condition silver Porsche.  It is pouri rain; the wind is blowing a San Francisco winter storm. is said a long beat as he drives.  She yawns.  Stretches. looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I'm tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got to be tiring to beat that  machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him and looks away.  A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I were guilty, and if I wanted  to beat that machine, it wouldn't  be tiring.  It wouldn't be tiring  at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm a professional liar.   I spend most of my waking hours  dwelling on my lies. (a beat) For my writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I love the rain, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says nothing, doesn't look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took a polygraph after you  shot those two people, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I passed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see?  We're both innocent,  Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls up in front of her house on Divisadero, stops. sees the white Ferrari in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know all this stuff  about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know all about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know anything that isn't  police business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) You know I don't like to wear any  underwear, don't you, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Thanks for the ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she's out of the car.  He watches her as she hurries the rain -- his eyes on her until the moment she opens th door and is inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a police bar, San Francisco style.  Ferns  Joe Mont and Will Clark posters.  The jukebox has a lot of Tony Be He walks in.  He sees Lt. Walker at a back booth with Gus goes to them, sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is all this "Nick" stuff -- Nick would you like a cigarette. Nick can you give me a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't ask me for the ride. She asked anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you volunteered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BARTENDER stays behind the bar, but yells to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perrier, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Double Black Jack rocks, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with concern) What you doin', son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my first drink in three months.   That okay with you, pop? (to Lt. Walker) She doesn't know me.  I never saw  her before Gus and I talked to  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up, gets his drink --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits back down.  He takes a big slug.  They watch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes another big slug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now what? Now nothing.  She  passed the polygraph.  That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knew she could beat it.  That's  why she asked to take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the fuck do you know?  What is  it with you and this broad anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Phil.  You're not gonna  let this slide.  What about her  parents?  What about what else  she's published?  At least we should  get the stuff to see if we find  anything else that's an amazing  real-life coincidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her parents died in an accident.   I don't care what else she's  written.  What are you -- a book  critic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did they die?  Was there an  investigation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you're saying she killed her  parents?  Did she kill Bobby  Vasquez, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not unless she got up in the ring  and turned into one mean  sonofabitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she did, Gus.  Maybe she  grew herself an Afro and learned a  left hook and put shoe polish on  her face.  Let's polygraph her  again and ask her about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casually) Fuck you, Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, too Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls to the  Bartender) Can you get me another double Black  Jack, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus looks at him with concern.  A man in his 50's -- LT. NILSEN  is suddenly there.  He is overweight, florid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nick) Hey, shooter -- You back on the  Black Jack, Shooter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grins.  Nick doesn't look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're discussing a case, Marty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that.  I had no doubt of  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nilsen takes the drink, hands it to Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) Double, huh, Shooter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick turns to him.  He's sitting in the booth; Nilsen is  standing there.  Nick looks like he's barely restraining  himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm off-duty, Nilsen.  You hear  me?  I'm off-duty discussing a  case.  Internal Affairs shouldn't  have any trouble with that.  Maybe  I should put in for overtime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) You do that, Shooter.  Why don't  you send it to me?  I'll give it  special attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, and then Nick gets up, faces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna tell you once more, Nilsen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Walker and Gus get up and hold Nick back. Beth Gardner, the police psychologist, is suddenly there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) No problem, Doctor.  Here comes  the Doctor just in time to save  her patient.  Take care, Shooter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he walks away.  Nick still looks like he wants to go him.  Beth pulls him away from the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) You don't look so okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks at her a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Baby-sitting. (she shrugs) Rookie cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) What else is new?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.  He looks at her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to get out of here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the booth, Gus and Lt. Walker watch the two of them le

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's for old-time's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watches them go  out) Sometimes I think he started banging  her just to get himself off the  hook with Internal Affairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat, smiles) He ain't that way.  He's got heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Yeah.  I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is kissing her -- hard, rough.  He forces her against wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't -- please, Nick --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear her dress RIP.  He kisses her harder -- we hear h panties RIP.  He gets the dress off, pushes his hands und her bra --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't -- don't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his mouth to her shoulder, bites it -- as they mo down to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is dark.  The are still partially dressed.  They are o floor.  He lies on his back, staring at the ceiling. She lies next to him -- the torn dress wound around her. There is a bite mark on her shoulder.  A long beat, silen then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was she like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine Tramell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) She said what you said she'd say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits up, looks away.  He looks at her, puts his finge the bite mark idly, gently.  A beat, and he kisses her sh gently, then lies back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met her at Berkeley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were in some of the same classes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with difficulty) You've never been... like that...   before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says nothing, looks away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't look at her a long beat, says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the shrink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She keeps looking at him.  He won't look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't making love to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat; he looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was I making love to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't making love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other, a long beat, then away.  He lies down.  Beth doesn't look at him, keeps sitting up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) I need a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) I thought you quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top drawer in the foyer. (a beat) Get it on your way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her; she won't look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks in.  He looks hung-over.  He sees Gus with Harri and Andrews and Lt. Walker in Lt. Walker's glass-enclosed at the end of this big room. They look at him when they see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like dogshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) He looks a little shrunk, that's  all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) We got a call from Berkeley P.D. There was a killing.  A professor. Icepick.  In his bed.  Multiple  stab wounds.  1977.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a thin smile) She was there, wasn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: University records say she was  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Nick look at each other a long beat, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly) Gus -- go over to Berkeley. Harrigan -- find out what else  she's published.  Andrews -- get  the files on her parents' accident. Carbon Beth on everything.  I want  some psychological input on this  Andrews and Harrigan go; Nick is  left there with Gus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're already gettin' psychological  input, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nick) Go stick your head in a tub of ice  water. (a beat; then  seriously) See where she leads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black Ferrari is in the driveway.  He sits in an unma police car on a hillside above the house, watching.  It i bleak, leaden gray day. Catherine comes out of the house.  She is dressed casuall She gets into the Ferrari.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stays behind her at a safe distance on the winding pan highway -- a two-lane mountain road which leads from Stin Beach into Marin County. She suddenly starts speeding up on this dangerous road, c in and out, passing cars very fast. He has to start cutting around cars to keep up.  This wom really drives. He cuts out and can barely pass a car without hitting a G Lines Tour Bus head-on.  Close call: sheer drops on eithe side. He looks frazzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is behind her at a distance on a hilly Mill Valley roa little streets, terraced hillsides, sharp turns. He goes slowly, looks around, thinks he's lost her.  And he sees the black Ferrari parked in front of a house obsc by hedges. He parks the car a distance behind the Ferrari, sits ther long beat.  He gets out, goes carefully up to the hedges, A small, nondescript house.  He watches.  He can't see an inside the house. A beat, he reaches over to the mailbox and opens it.  He an envelope out, looks at the name Hazel Dobkins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches as she comes out of the house.  A frail old wo in her 70's is with her.  She hugs the old woman, gets in the Ferrari, STARTS it up. He waits a beat and then STARTS after her.  He stays behi her at a distance -- she is going slowly.  And then she s GUNS it, cuts her lights -- her wheels SCREECH. He GUNS his car after her.  He makes a turn.  She is gone There is a fork in the road.  He turns one way, goes a fe hundred feet. Nothing.  Blackness.  He stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls his car up to her house at Stinson Beach.  The b Ferrari is in the driveway. A light goes on in an upstairs bedroom.  The curtain is d He sees the outline of her body now. She starts to take her clothes off -- there in the window behind the curtain.  He watches her body as she does an a languorous strip.  His eyes are intense... ravishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is alone, nobody else in the big room. He sits in front of a computer.  We see the screen.  He h punched in HAZEL DOBKINS, WF, 145 ALBION RD., MILL VALLEY. He is waiting for a response.  We see it come on screen NOTHING CURRENT. A long beat, as he stares at the screen, and then we see words RELEASED, SAN QUENTIN, JULY 7, 1965. We see him type in the words PRIOR ARREST RECORD. A long beat, and then it comes up

dialogues.speaker: HOMICIDE, JANUARY 10, 1956
dialogues.text: He stares at the screen a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (behind him) Ain't you go nothin' better to do  than to come in here and jack off  the damn machine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat; lost  in his thoughts) What are you doing here, Pop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) I came in here to jack off the  damn machine. (a beat) One dead psychology professor. Noah Goldstein.  Dr. Noah Goldstein.   And guess what?  He was her  counselor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks at him a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was she ever suspect?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.  They never even got a  statement from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick sits back a long beat, his eyes off somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly) Do you remember a case -- 1956 -- Hazel Dobkins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) Hell yes!  Couldn't get it outta  my head for years.  Still can't.   Nice little kids -- nice husband,  wasn't porkin' around -- no  financial problems.  One day --  outta the clear blue sky -- she  does 'em.  All of 'em.  Used a  knife. He got for a wedding present.   Didn't even deny it.  Sweet as  honey.  Said she didn't know why  she done it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick just stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls up to the house, gets out of his unmarked police He stands there a beat, thinking.  He walks down to the b entrance of the house.  He hears a Rolling Stones SONG pl inside.  He stands there.  The door suddenly opens.  Cath stands there, smiles.  She wears very tight-fitting spand leotards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her a beat, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I... disturbing you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have their eyes on each other.  A beat, and she turn go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes in ahead of him -- he follows her inside.  He wa her body.  His movements are tentative, off-balance.  She the Stones DOWN. On a table by the window, he sees a word processor.  Spre around it are newspaper clippings.  They are all about hi We see the headline on one KILLER COP TO FACE POLICE REVI She sees him glancing at the clips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm using you for my detective.   In my book.  You don't mind, do  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles.  He looks at her, expressionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a drink?  I was  just going to have one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) That's right.  You're off the Jack  Daniels too, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is making herself a drink.  She takes the ice out and opens a drawer and gets an icepick.  It has a fat wooden She uses the icepick on the ice, her back to him.  He wat her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to ask you a few more  questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to ask you some, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to him, icepick in hand, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For my book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns back to the ice, works on it with the pick.  Sh raises her arm, plunges it.  Raises it, plunges it.  He w her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wary) What kind of questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts the icepick down, pours herself a drink, turns t him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does it feel to kill someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) You tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  But you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes are on each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) It was an accident.  They got in  the line of fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four shootings in five years.  All  accidents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a long beat) They were drug buys.  I was a vice  cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat, as they look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about Professor Goldstein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a name from the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a name from the present? How about Hazel Dobkins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him a long beat, sips her drink, never takes eyes off him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noah was my counselor in my freshman  year. (she smiles) That's probably where I got the  idea for the icepick.  For my book. Funny how the subconscious works. (a beat) Hazel is my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wiped out her whole family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  She's helped me understand  homicidal impulse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you study it in school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only in theory. (she smiles) You know all about homicidal  impulse, don't you, shooter?  Not  in theory -- in practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at her a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) What happened, Nick?  Did you get  sucked into it? Did you like it  too much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at her, almost horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Tell me about the coke, Nick.  The  day you shot those two tourists -- how much coke did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps closer to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts her hand softly on his cheek,  He grabs her hand roughly, holds it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you did.  They never tested  you, did they?  But Internal Affairs  knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are face to face.  He is still holding her roughly b hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wife knew, didn't she?  She  knew what was going on.  Nicky got  too close to the flame.  Nicky  liked it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He twists her arm back behind her -- their bodies are pre against each other -- their eyes digging into each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a whisper) That's why she killed herself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is twisting her arm, staring at her, pulling her again him.  We hear the DOOR behind them.  A beat, and he lets go, turns away from her. Roxy stands there, staring at them.  Her hair is up.  She a black motorcycle jacket, a black T-shirt, and black jea and cowboy boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brightly) Hiya, hon.  You two have met,  haven't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roxy looks at Nick.  Catherine goes to her, kisses her br on the lips, stands there with her arm around her --both them looking at Nick. He walks by them, opens the door to go, his face a mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to make a terrific  character, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't look at her; he's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes in.  He looks like he's going to kill someone. RECEPTIONIST sits there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's on the phone -- she'll be  right with you, detective --He  sweeps by her into Beth's inner  office.  She hangs up when she  sees the look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who has access to my file?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about, Nick -- what's wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's got access to my goddamn  file?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up -- he goes closer to her; she backs away from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes closer to her; she backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a confidential psychiatric  record, it'd be illegal --She backs  into a wall.  She looks very scared.   He comes very close to her -- puts  an arm behind her to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't, Beth.  Don't lie to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says nothing, looks scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly) It's Internal Affairs, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Nick, please --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud, hard) Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blurts it) Nilsen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He storms into the big room.  He sees MARTY NILSEN.  He i sitting behind his desk in his glass-enclosed office insi this big room.  About a dozen plainclothes policemen are the big room.  He goes by them into Nilsen's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes the door.  Nilsen sees the look on his face, ba his chair away towards the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want, Curran?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to him, picks him up by his lapels, slams him aga the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of control) You sold her the file, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared) What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of control) What'd she pay you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams him against the wall again.  The glass EXPLODES them -- a chair comes into the room.  Nick is frozen, hol Nilsen by the throat against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him go, Curran.  Nice and easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks back, sees two Internal Affairs men with their g drawn, pointed at him.  A beat, and he lets Nilsen go.  H turns calmly and starts to walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on sick leave, Shooter.  As  of right now.  Pending the outcome  of a psychiatric evaluation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets into his old Porsche.  He STARTS the car up.  Gus comes up to the window.  They look at each other a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's goin' down, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin' (a beat) I'll be okay, pop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.  You won't.  There's smoke  off yonder on the horizon.  They're  gonna want your badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a long beat) I got tired of being played with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) You sure got real conclusive ways  of demonstrating that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They almost smile at each other, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost to himself) She knows where I live and breathe.   She's coming after me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a long beat) What is it you got between you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat; to  himself) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somethin', though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, and then Nick looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (a beat) Somethin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits in front of the TV, watching a lame sitcom.  A bo of Jack Daniels is half-empty in front of him.  He is smo a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (behind him) I still have my key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her, looks away at the sitcom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to see you, Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps watching the sitcom.  A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly angry) Damnit!  Don't shut me out!  You  owe me more than that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to the TV, shuts it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't owe you anything; you don't  owe me anything. (he looks at her) We went to bed -- what was it? -- ten or fifteen times? (he smiles) It wasn't memorable enough to carry  any obligations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a long beat) Sometimes I really hate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Yeah?  Well why don't you find  some friendly therapist and work  some of that hostility out. (a beat) But take my advice.  Put a little  more life into it than you usually  do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, and she suddenly hurls herself at him in absolute trying to claw at his face.  He grabs her, blocks her.  T look at each other a long beat and then he lets her go. The emotion of the moment is gone now -- they turn away f each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) I'm sorry... I don't usually...  act like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks at her a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you let him have my file,  Beth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not looking at him) He was going to recommend your  discharge a behavioral disability.   I made a deal with him.  He could  review the session notes himself.   It was the only way I could keep  you on the force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him.  He looks away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did it for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I care about you.  I did it  for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Get out of here, Beth. (a beat) Please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to the Jack Daniel's, pours some more.  She looks him pour it and turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is asleep on the couch -- the TV is on to a blank scre The Jack Daniel's is mostly gone.  The phone on the coffe table RINGS.  It RINGS again.  He wakes, picks it up, lis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (a beat) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs it up.  He sits there a long beat, staring.  He disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks down the alley.  There are lots of police cars,  flashing lights, uniformed men, coroner's men. As he walks down the alley, he sees Lt. Walker, Gus, and of the Internal Affairs men we saw earlier in Nilsen's of They are standing around a Lincoln Town Car. They look at him as he comes closer to them -- then move He can see into the car now.  Martin Nilsen lies against front seat.  He has been shot in the head.  Nick stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One shot.  Close range.  Probably  a .38 caliber revolver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick stares at Nilsen's body.  They watch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your gun, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, and then Nick gives him his gun.  Walker smells i shakes his head, gives it to one of the Internal Affairs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Walker) You think I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't son, but I got the minority  opinion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits in the same room that Catherine sat in --surround four or five Internal Affairs men, Lt. Walker, Gus, and Captain Talcott.  Lt. Walker and Gus sor sit back -- I.A. is running the investigation.  The same stenographer -- the same plain young woman -- is sitting the room who was there with Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  I went after him.  I lost  my temper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any evidence that he  showed your psychiatric file to  anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth Gardner comes into the room.  They look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll speak to you afterwards, Dr. Gardner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick gives her a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to sit-in if you don't  mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd really rather --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see anything wrong with  Dr. Gardner sitting-in if Detective  Curran doesn't object.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks at her, shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home. Watching TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you drinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you start drinking again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) A couple days ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw Detective Curran at his  apartment around ten o'clock.  He  was sober and lucid.  I asked him  in my capacity as his departmental  therapist about his altercation  with Lt. Nilsen.  He expressed  regret and displayed no hostility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Beth) How long were you at his apartment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About fifteen minutes.  I saw there  was no reason for my concern and  left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She and Nick look at each other.  He looks away and light cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no smoking in this building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) What are you gonna do -- charge me  with smoking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the exact line that Catherine used.  A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll ask you once, Nick -- for the  record did you kill him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at him a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on -- I'm going to storm into  his office in front of everybody  in the afternoon and then that  night I'm going to kill him?  I'd  have to be really dumb to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going after him before gets you  off the hook for killing him that's  your alibi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like writing a book about killing  a guy gets you off the hook for  killing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Walker) I don't understand.  What are you  talking about?  What book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nick) Private joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it's funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) Well, hell, son, it's got a certain  ring to it, I'll say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is by the elevators with Gus and Lt. Andrews.  He spot Beth going for the stairway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lt. Andrews) I'll get my stuff tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops.  He catches up to her.  They walk down the fli together.  They speak quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him, smiles.  They keep walking down the ste

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the least I could do...   considering I got you into this  mess with those reports.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) No.  I mean it, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know Catherine Tramell  saw my reports?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows stuff about me that only  you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) She must really be something. (she smiles) From a clinical point of view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was she like in school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hardly knew her.  She gave me  the creeps, though.  I don't know  why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get outside.  Beth kisses him quickly, softly on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some rest.  Promise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods.  She starts walking toward her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth.  I didn't mean what I said.   About --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Yes you did.  I'm a big girl.  I  can handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is cleaning his desk out, putting things into a duffel Only Andrews is in the room.  We see Lt. Walker sitting i glass-enclosed office. He closes the duffel bag, looks at the place a long beat. Andrews is watching him.  He goes up to Andrews

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Take care, you hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Did you find out about her parents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on leave, man. (a beat) You're on psycho leave.  I'm talking  to a possible whacko here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I'm whacko, Sam, what'd  you find?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, and Andrews opens the file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat blew.  There was a leak  in the gas line.  There were two  previous repairs.  There was a  five-mil policy on both of 'em.  A  real heavy investigation.  Zilch.   Goose-egg.  It was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees Lt. Walker looking at him.  He goes into Walker's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I.A.'s going to talk to you more  about Nilsen.  They're handling  the investigation, we're not.   Stay in touch with Dr. Gardner,  it'll help on the evaluation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
