dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it wasn't her that paid him. Maybe the money was for somethin'  else.  How the fuck do I know?   I'm just an old city cowboy tryin'  not to fall outta his saddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks at him and smiles a thin smile; he's not there he's completely preoccupied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone is watching as he and Gus come out of the diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands by Gus as Gus gets into his battered, rusted, v Cadillac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right, pop?  You want me  to drive you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that little pissant car of yours?   Hell, no.  I ain't gettin' no back  pain disability retirement -- I'm  gettin' me a full pension and a  real gold-plate Seiko watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I'll drive you in this  thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'd let you drive my  Cadillac car?  I ain't lettin' no  hear-up-his-ass person drive my  Cadillac car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he steps on the gas and ROARS out of there, forcing N to get out of the way.  Nick looks after him a long beat, his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone is following him slowly as he walks down the stre He turns a corner, walks down the alley towards his Porsc parked behind the country and western bar. The car suddenly speeds up -- ROARS down on him from the full bore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hurls himself across the Porsche's hood... barely avoi the car.  He sees the car at the end of the alley, turnin It is a black Ferrari.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He GUNS it down the alley, makes a wild turn in the direc the Ferrari turned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Porsche dodges around cars very fast, almost side-swi them, looking almost out of control, its MOTOR screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees the Ferrari turn ahead.  When he gets to where it turned, he turns wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari is making fast, wild turns into little street North Beach, its MOTOR screaming -- the Porsche is gainin ground behind it, making turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari is up ahead and makes a wild right turn onto road going up a hillside.  He yanks the wheel hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Porsche rockets up the steps -- bouncing high into th air, almost out of control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it crests the steps and gets to the street.  Nick GUNS and it looks like it flies high down the hill-side into  blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it lands on more steps -- heading downward -- bucking almost spinning, it bounces onto the next street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another set of steps leading up he GUNS it, it rockets up ROARS, bucking --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And lands on the next street.  Nick makes a wild right tu onto the street.  And the black Ferrari appears from arou curve to the right, heading right for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick steps on the GAS and heads head-on for the Ferrari. The Ferrari SCREAMS head-on for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And at the last moment, in the game of chicken, the Ferra tries to swerve around him on this narrow road, goes out control and over the side, turning over and over as it ro down the hillside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ferrari has landed right-side up. He runs down the hillside and gets to it.  A beat, and he the car door. Roxy lies hunched over the wheel, her eyes open.  Her nec broken.  She is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police lights have been set up.  He stands there with Lt. Walker and several of the Internal Affairs men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me again.  I want to hear you  say it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat;  sheepish) It was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're driving around North Beach  for no particular reason and this  car won't get out of the way --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think she meant to go off  the hill, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Don't fuck with me, Nick.  I don't  need a reason to put your ass in a  sling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Nick look at each other a long beat.  Andrews come to them with a piece of paper in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full name, Roxanne Hardy.  Last  address -- Cloverdale, California.   No priors, no convictions.  The  car is registered to Catherine  Tramell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Walker looks at Nick like he's going to kill him.  Ni looks calmly away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew her, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus and I talked to her at Tramell's  house.  All we did was write her  name down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) I told you to stay away from  Tramell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat; smiles) Yeah.  But you didn't tell me to  stay away from her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walker looks at him in absolute disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you in Dr. Gardner's office  at nine o'clock.  You're out of  control, Curran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the I.A. Man) Who are you guys gonna sell my  file to this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at him.  He watches as Roxy's body is taken aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks in.  He looks good, in control.  Beth Gardner is sitting there with two middle-aged MEN, both of them wear suits, who smile and scrutinize him the instant he walks the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Nick.  This is Dr. Myron  and R. McElwaine.  They've been  asked to consult with me on this  evaluation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick gives him a look: What did he think he was going to stand there? He sits down, looks at them.  A beat, as they look at him then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (courtly) Nick -- when you recollect your  childhood, are your recollections  pleasing to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks at them a long beat in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly, directly) Number one I don't remember how  often I used to jack off, but it  was a lot.  Number two I didn't  get pissed off at my dad -- even  after I was old enough to know  what he and mom were doing in the  bedroom.  Number three I don't  look in the toilet before I flush  it.  Number four I don't wet the  bed and haven't for some time. Number five You can go fuck  yourselves because I'm out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is walking away quickly.  Beth is with him, trying to up.  She is very angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your problem?  I'm trying  to help you.  Why won't you let me  help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need any help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you do.  Something's on with  you. (a beat) You're sleeping with her, aren't  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, he stops looks at her, then keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this interest you've got  in her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My interest is in you, not in her. She seduces people, she manipulates --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you hardly know her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the type.  I'm a  psychologist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) That means you manipulate people  too, doesn't it, Beth?  You're a  practicing psychologist -- that  means you're better at it than she  is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) I feel sorry for you, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, and she turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is driving down winding road to Stinson house.  He i driving very fast, passing other cars on the winding and  twisting road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick enters and shuts door.  Looking around, he does not her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine! (after a beat) Catherine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally he sees her sitting by the window.  He walks over her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (near tears) I should have known.  I came into  the house when you were down on  the beach.  She looked at me so  strangely.  She left right after  you. (a beat) I shouldn't have let her watch us.   She wanted to watch me all the  time.  She tried to kill you, didn't  she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) Did you like her to watch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long beat) Do you think I told her to kill  You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly, with  intensity) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat, near  tears) Everybody that I care about dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is about to break into uncontrolable sobbing.  Nick p his arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soothing) It's OK.  It's OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly, almost  begging) Make love to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are seen rolling and turning around on each other. Their love making is sensual, sincere. Later in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly, but  seriously) Do you think she killed Johnny  Boz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised, startled) For what... to set me up?  She  loved me she wouldn't frame me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) Maybe she got jealous of Johnny  Boz, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) No, she didn't... she never got  jealous before... she got excited. (a beat) I don't have luck with women. There was this girl I met while I  was in college.  I slept with her  once.  She started following me  around, taking my picture.  She  dyed her hair, copied my clothes. Lisa something... Oberman.  It was  awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat, he looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you didn't do adolescent  secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) I never have before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a bright, sunshiny day.  He is out there looking at water.  She comes up behind him, hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (full of life) Isn't it just beautiful?  I love  it here like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold) We're still playing games, aren't  we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold) No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more games, Nick.  I'm tired of  playing games!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have their eyes on each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then tell me about Nilsen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns away from him.  He watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, she looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I paid him $50,000 in cash for  your psychiatric file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About three months before I met  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd read about your shootings in  the papers.  I decided to write a  book about a detective.  I wanted  to know my character.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You paid $50,000 for your character?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would've paid more.  I wanted to  know everything about you.  Then  you came down here after Johnny  got killed... it gave me a chance  to get to know my character better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a long beat) What about the other night. What  about last night?  Was that to get  to know your character?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Maybe I'm losing interest in my  book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes are on each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll convince you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she kisses him slowly, with more and more heat, on th lips. The cordless phone on the deck table goes off.  It keeps  RINGING.  She breaks finally from the kiss, picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She listens a beat, then hands him the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Gus-who-doesn't-like-me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine says you don't like her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) She's right.  You got an icepick  in you yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine sees him smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked if I had an icepick in me  yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) You know that stuff they say about  how you can judge people by their  friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) You're my friend, Gus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seriously) I'm gonna make you believe in it,  friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In CLOSEUP: We see a large, glossy photograph of Roxy. She looks about thirteen.  She has braces in her teeth. Nick is looking at the photo -- it is in a file in his ha He sits there with Gus in front of a woman juvenile offic He turns the file and we see a glossy of a little boy in pool of blood. Nick looks up at the woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) How old was she when this happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen.  We seal juvenile records  until they're deceased.  That's  why you didn't find it in your  computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the motive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said she didn't know herself,  just sort of did it on impulse. (she shrugs) The razor just happened to be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what she said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a small, old, rural buildinga lot of Four-H type st on the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand what the hell's  going on here, pop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't that hard, son.  This young  farmgirl, she got tired of all  that attention goin' to her little  brothers -- she fixed 'em.  Just  like 'ole Hazel Dobkins fixed her  whole family -- except young Roxy  here, she didn't use a wedding  present.  She used Daddy's razor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are going to their cars, parked side by side.  The P looks pretty badly banged up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sure makes you wonder what they  talked about when they set  themselves down in front of the  campfire at night.   You ever met  any of her friends who hasn't killed  somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It musta beat your ordinary everyday  girl talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick get into his car, sits there a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure anymore she did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Which one you talkin' about now,  son?  We know ole Hazel did it; we  know young Roxy did it -- and the  other one Well, hell, she's got  that magna come lawdy pussy on her  that done fried up your brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young woman is checking a computer.  Nick is with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson.  Jack W. Donald M.  I'm  sorry.  No Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you check all four years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in disbelief) Can you check again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a look, but punches it in again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Lisa Anderson, detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Can there be some mistake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (straining patience) Only if you're making it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets out of the Porsche, starts to go in.  He looks di Catherine comes out of the house with Hazel Dobkins, the woman we saw with her in Mill Valley.  Nick watches them beat, then goes up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hazel , this is Nick.  I told you  all about him.  This is Hazel  Dobkins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) You're the Shooter, aren't you? How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her sort of warily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ( to Catherine) Can I talk to you a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hazel) Honey, why don't you go in the  car?  I'll be right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old woman starts going to the Ferrari.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brightly) Goodbye, Shooter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks at Hazel a beat, then at Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like to hang out with murderers  or what?  Did you know Roxy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casually) Look.  Sometimes when I do my  research, I get involved with  people.  It happened with you,  too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles.  He looks at her, doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killing isn't like smoking.  You  can quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her What did she say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (preoccupied) I've go to go.  I promised to get  her home by six o'clock.  She just  loves "America's Most Wanted."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: America's Most Wanted?  She turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no Lisa Anderson at  Berkeley when you were there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops, looks at him a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing, checking up  on me?  What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says nothing.  A long beat, she looks hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Henderson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henderson.  Lisa Henderson.  With  an H.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits in front of a computer screen with Andrews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get my butt kicked for this. You're not supposed to be in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not gonna take long, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the computer screen.  The screen says LISA HENDERS DMV LICENSE CHECK We wait and then we see the words 1983 ELIZABETH GARDNER, 147 QUEENSTON DRIVE, SALINAS, CAL. Nick stares at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring it up, will you, Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, and then we see the license itself It is Beth Gar on the photo.  Nick stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's Dr. Gardner, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring 1976 up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, and the license comes up.  We see a young Beth Ga on the photo.  She has blonde hair. Nick stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks in.  The apartment is dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't leave your door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) I didn't.  Something's wrong with  my lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, she looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold) What do you want, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Tell me about Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him a long beat, then turns away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told you, didn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) What did she tell me, Beth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a long beat) I slept with her once in school. (a beat) I was just a kid.  I was  experimenting.  It was just that  one time. (a beat) She developed a... fixation... on  me.  She styled her hair like mine.   She wore the same kind of clothes  I did.  It scared me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him, sees his look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that what she told you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told me it was you.  You wore  the same kind of clothes.  You  dyed your hair blonde.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat as they look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did dye my hair.  It didn't have  anything to do with her.  I was a  redhead for a while, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Did you know Noah Goldstein?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had him in two classes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw all the reports, Beth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil had you copied.  You never said anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) What do I say -- Hey, listen, guys,  I'm not gay, but I did fuck your  suspect. (she turns away) I was embarrassed.  It's the only  time I've been with a woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's really sick you know.  Don't  you know what she's doing?  She  knows I went to Berkeley.  She  knows I knew Noah.  She makes up  that story about me.  She's handing  you somebody who's obsessed with  he her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't hand you to me.  She  doesn't even know who you are.   She told me about Lisa Henderson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knew you'd find out who Lisa  Henderson is.  You're a good cop -- what did she do?  Tell you casually  and make it seem irrelevant? (she smiles) Did she tell you in bed, Nick? That's how I'd do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks at her a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you change your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got married. (a beat) He was on staff at the clinic.  I  was down in Salinas.  It didn't...   last long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up.  He looks at her a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick -- Do you really think I...   that I could kill someone... I  never even met Johnny Boz.  What  about Nilsen?  What possible motive  would I have to kill him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should do something about this  lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's evil.  She's brilliant.  Be  careful, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets out of his Porsche.  He walks toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts going up the dark stairway.  There is a hand on neck.  He spins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Do I scare you, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her, doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I just thought I'd surprise you. (a beat) What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) I found Lisa Henderson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you?  What's she doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her, doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to tell me what  she's doing. (a beat) I thought we weren't playing games  anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) I did, too. (a beat) She told me it was backwards --  she said you even styled your hair  the way she did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine looks at him a beat, then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you believed her?  I even went  down to the campus  police and  made out a report about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still think I kill people,  don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands with an old CAMPUS COP.  He is going through fi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who'd you say you were with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homicide.  San Francisco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops at a file, opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you guys communicate over  there?  You must be the same way  we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick doesn't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a report about Lisa  Henderson -- January, 1977 -- the  file's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean it's not here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: San Francisco P.D. Detective Nilsen.   Internal Affairs.  You know him?   Tell him we want it back.  He's  had it a whole year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Gus sit there -- they look tired, upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Nilsen had a report on her --  so what.  You don't know what the  hell was in it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine told me what was in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she's telling  you the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you get it, Gus?  If Beth  killed Johnny Boz to frame Catherine --  she wouldn't want anyone to know  what happened at Berkeley.  It  gives her the motive to kill Nilsen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did she know Nilsen knew about  it -- if it happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was I.A.  He probably asked her  about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus thinks about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'd have to be nuttier than a  twenty-pound Christmas fruitcake.   She's not the one who hangs out  with multiple murderers -- your  girlfriend is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a writer -- it's part of  what she does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irate) Goddamn writers -- all they do is  use up trees and ruin people's  eyes. (a beat) There's gotta be somebody at  Berkeley who knows what the hell  happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what happened.  Catherine  told me what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat,  quietly) You got goddamn tweety-birds  flutterin' around your head, that's  what you got.  You think you're  gonna fuck like minks, raise  rugrats, and live happily ever  after?  Oh, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has his key out to open his door.  He hears MUSIC insi A beat, and he opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is dark.  We hear a Rolling Stones SONG.  He sees Cath standing by a window, watching him.  She wears black jean the black motorcycle jacket. They look at each other a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I decided to give you one more  chance. (a beat) I missed you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't not see me long enough  to miss me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you miss me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come over here and tell me no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks up close to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She unzips her motorcycle jacket slowly.  She wears nothi underneath it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's below the belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet it isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls him close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're getting there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit in the window seat, naked.  His back is against wall.  She sits against him.  He has his legs around her. They don't look at each other.  She is smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to do some research tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very good at research.  I'll  help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you researching?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm writing a book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Really.  What are you writing about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A detective.  He falls for the  wrong girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) What happens to them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) They fuck like minks, raise rugrats,  and live happily ever after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) It won't sell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Somebody has to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody always does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks in; it is a small valley hospital.  He goes up t desk.  There are two women there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm looking for a Dr. Gardner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) We don't have a Dr. Gardner on  staff here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Joseph Gardner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He died -- about five or six years  ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) He was shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick sits with a sheriff's DETECTIVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was walking home from work. They only lived a coupla blocks  from the clinic.  Somebody drove  by and shot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the weapon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .38 revolver.  Never recovered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were there ever any suspects?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No suspects, no motive.  Unsolved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Was his wife ever a suspect?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) I had another one of you guys down  here from Frisco -- about a year  ago -- he asked me the same  question.  What's this about anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Routine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he said it was routine too. Now it's two guys saying it's  routine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a long beat) Nope, can't say that I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nilsen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was she ever a suspect?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. (a beat) There was some talk; it never  panned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The usual -- a girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had a girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. She did. (a beat) Like I say.  It never panned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat, gets  up) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope I helped you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) You did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks around the house; he sees her sitting out on the a portable word-processor in front of her.  She is smokin He goes up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Hi.  I missed you.  I finished my  research.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves toward her.  She moves away, kills her cigarette

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I finished my book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did it end?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) I told you.  She kills him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Goodbye, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at her.  A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I finished my book. (a beat) Didn't you hear me?* (a beat) Your character's dead. (a beat) Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at her.  He can't believe what she is saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want, Nick?  Flowers?   I'll send you some flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) What is this -- some kind of... Joke? (a beat; he almost  smiles) Are we playing games again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) The games are over.  You were right.   It was the fuck of the century,  Shooter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks -- Hazel Dobkins is there. Catherine still has her eyes on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, and then she turns to go inside.  Hazel Dobkins s slowly at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits in his Porsche, staring ahead.  He is parked next Gus' Cadillac.  Gus is suddenly there, onway to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) Catherine Tramell's roommate her  freshman year.  I got a call from  her.  I've been calling people who  were in her dorm all day.  She  must've heard I was trying to talk  to her.  She says she knows all  about Catherine and Lisa Henderson.   She's over in Oakland.  You wanna  come with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick just stares ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like you seen a ghost,  son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) Johnny Boz's psychiatrist has an  office on Van Ness.  Guess who he  shares office space with?  Dr.   Elizabeth Gardner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick doesn't even respond.  Gus looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in hell's the matter with  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick doesn't say anything, stares ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus gets out with Nick.  It is an old building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell you goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) I'm going with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said alone -- suite 405.  It  ain't gonna take long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, and Nick gets back in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus is on the first floor.  There is no one around.  He h the elevator button.  A beat, and it comes.  He steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits the button for the fourth floor. The elevator rises a floor, stops.  The door opens.  Ther no one there.  Then it starts going up again.  It rises t third floor.  It stops.  The door opens.  There is no one Then it starts to rise again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick sits there, staring ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly, screaming) Gus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it goes up.  It stops.  The door starts to open.  As i does -- a figure in a hooded raincoat sweeps into the ele It happens very fast.  We see blonde hair around the face But we don't see the face itself -- the head is down, the up.  There is an icepick in the figure's hand.  The figur explodes into Gus.  The icepick goes into his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick tears desperately up the stairway -- he hits the fou floor door.  It explodes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands there a beat, sees the elevator door open.  He there,  He sees Gus, crumpled into the corner of the elev

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes into the elevator -- holds Gus.  He is dead.  A l beat.  He sees the gun in Gus' hand -- he takes the gun o his hand.  He runs out of the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hears something.  Gun in hand, he runs towards the SOU He stops, gun in hand, listens again.  He runs again, hea nothing. Behind him, we see a figure. He spins suddenly, gun, in hand.  Beth Gardner is there. She wears a windbreaker.  She has her hands in the pocket

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Put your hands up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams) Put your fucking hands up!  Don't  move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a message on my machine to  meet Gus here.  Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles a strange smile.  She takes a step toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams) Don't! (a beat) I know about your husband.  You  still like girls, Beth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles strangely again, takes a step toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams) Take your hands out of your pockets!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves a hand in a pocket and moves towards him fast -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he FIRES the gun.  She is hit in the chest, goes down A long beat, and then he goes to her.  He gets down on th ground.  Her eyes are open.  He empties the pockets of th windbreaker -- first one, then the other the pockets are

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a whisper) I loved you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of policemen, coroner's guys, photos being taken. Nick stands there with Lt. Walker, Harrigan, and some of Internal Affairs guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset) What made you think she had a gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick says nothing; he looks like a zombie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was she doing here?   What was Gus doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrews yells to them from the stairway door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FORENSICS MAN very carefully handles a hooded rain coat stair landing.  He wears gloves. Nick is there with Lt. Walker. The Forensics Man picks the raincoat up -- a long blonde falls out of it.  There are flecks of blood on it. He reaches into the pocket and pulls out an  icepick.  It a thin steel handle and is bloody.  He hands the icepick assistant. He looks at the raincoat.  It has blood on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's departmental issue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick with Lt. Walker.  Nick looks like a zombie.  Andrews up to them.  He has a gun in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-eight caliber revolver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bottom drawer, bureau in the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have  ballistics check it for  Nilsen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harrigan comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, you'd better come in  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Walker goes into the kitchen.  Nick follows him. There are several cops around a kitchen cabinet.  A drawe open. Walker looks -- we look with him.  We see a copy of Love Catherine's paperback book, and a stack of photos of Cath Walker picks the photos up, goes through them -- we see s of Catherine in college -- Catherine at a fight --Catheri with Johnny Boz -- Catherine with Roxy. He hands the photos to Nick. Nick stares at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick sits, his feet up.  He looks like a zombie.  With hi Lt. Walker, Andrews, and Captain Talcott.  We see other  plainclothesmen in the b.g. -- a flurry of activity, peop phones.  A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She must've heard you on the  stairway and dumped the stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick says nothing, stares off. A DETECTIVE comes over to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no suite 405 in that  building.  Catherine Tramell's  roommate in her freshman year is  dead.  She died of leukemia two  years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An INTERNAL AFFAIRS MAN comes over to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our files on Dr. Gardner show  nothing about a police report in  Berkeley -- nothing related to  Salinas, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat -- the phone RINGS.  Andrews picks it up, lis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ballistics says the .38 we found  in her apartment matches Nilsen.   No registration.  They're checking  with Salinas.  The icepick is the  same brand and model as the Boz  weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat -- Nick just stares. Harrigan comes up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We checked the tape machines at  Dr.  Gardner's apartment and at  her office -- both here and the  one on Van Ness.  No message from  Gus on any of 'em.  The one at her  apartment was broken. (a beat) Johnny Boz's psychiatrist says he  thinks he remembers Dr. Gardner  and Boz meeting at a Christmas  party at his house a year ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a long beat,  sadly) You just can't tell about people,  can you.  Even the ones you think  you know inside-out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Nick look at each other a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Curran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks at him, expressionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He parks his car.  It is dark.  Foggy. He starts heading inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes in.  He starts to walk up the dark stairway, we s him walking up several flights of steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens his door with his key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks in.  The apartment is dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (behind him) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a whisper, almost a hiss.  He spins, fast.  Catheri stands there, pressing herself against a wall.  They look each other a long beat.  She looks like she is almost in trance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard about it... on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her, expressionless.  A long beat, their eyes into each other.  She looks like she is almost shivering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't allow myself to care about  you -- I can't allow myself to  care -- I can't -- I can't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks very emotional.  He moves towards her, puts his around her, holds her very close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a whisper) I don't want to do this -- please -- I don't want to do this -- I lose  everybody -- I don't want to lose  you -- I don't want to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses her closer and closer to himself, holds her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is dark; we can't see clearly. Atop her... he makes love to her... gently... tenderly... hardly moving inside her... there are tears in her eyes..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atop him... she is on her knees, straddling him... he is his back, his eyes are closed... her head arches back... breasts high... he strains toward her with his body...  s holds her arms high... her right hand is in a fist... (we only see the back of her hand and arm)... it comes do suddenly... he bucks... writhes... then her whole body fa on top of him. A very long beat... We can't see him... her body completely covers him... And then finally he moves... turns her to the side...  ki her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Stones play "Sympathy For The Devil"  in the b.g.; th MUSIC is low. They lie next to each other on the bed.  The CAMERA faces He lies, staring at the ceiling, on the left side of the smoking a cigarette.  She is curled away from him toward right side of the bed.  A long beat, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do now, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a long beat) We fuck like minks.  We raise  rugrats.  We live happily ever  after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see her right arm go to the side of the bed and then o He stares at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate rugrats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a long beat) We fuck like minks.  We forget the  rugrats.  We live happily ever  after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see from an ANGLE to the left side of the bed now Her is expressionless.  Her right arm dangles over the right of the bed.  Her right hand is clenched.  Is she holding  something in it against her arm? We see them from an ANGLE to the left side of the bed now turns his body away from her to put out his cigarette. We see her behind him slowly turning towards him and the A beat, and he turns towards her. They look at each other.  A long beat as the SONG gets lo We see them in CLOSEUP.  We don't see her right arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a whisper) I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, and he kisses her.  The CAMERA BACKS AWAY from th slowly to the right side of the bedroom as they kiss, and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... A long beat, as the SONG keeps playing... and we...

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: We see them from the right side of the bedroom.  And then CAMERA LOWERS SLOWLY as they kiss with more and more pass It keeps going LOWER. There is something under the bed.  The CAMERA MOVES CLOSE towards it as "SYMPATHY FOR THE DEVIL" plays louder.  We it now in CLOSEUP as the bed rustles above... It is a thin, steel-handled icepick. The SONG plays LOUDER and LOUDER, and we --
